alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Armstrong, Randall, southeastern Oldham, eastern Deaf Smith and southern Potter Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Amarillo to 8 miles northwest of Umbarger to 7 miles northwest of Hereford. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Bushland, Buffalo Lake, Wayside, Umbarger, Wildorado, Palo Duro Canyon, Mescalero Park, Dawn, Simms and Timbercreek Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall
